name: memory

tools.name: create-entities
tools.title: Create Entities
tools.description: Create new entities in the knowledge graph.
tools.instructions: Create multiple new entities in the knowledge graph.

name.description: The unique name of the entity to create.

entityType.description: The type or classification of the entity.

observations.description: Array of initial observations about the entity.

entities.description: A list of new entities to create in the knowledge graph.

tools.name: create-relations
tools.title: Create Relations
tools.instructions: Create relations between existing entities in the knowledge graph.

relations.description: A list of new relations to create between entities.

tools.name: add-observations
tools.title: Add Observations
tools.description: Add new observations to existing entities
tools.instructions: Add new observations to existing entities in the knowledge graph.

entityName.description: The name of the entity to which observations will be added.

observations.description: A list of observations to add to existing entities.

tools.name: delete-entities
tools.title: Delete Entities
tools.instructions: Delete entities from the knowledge graph along with their related relations.

entityNames.description: Names of the entities to delete from the graph.

tools.name: delete-observations

tools.instructions: Delete specific observations from existing entities.

entityName.description: The name of the entity from which observations will be removed.

observations.description: The observations to delete from the entity.

deletions.description: A list of deletions describing which observations to remove.

tools.name: delete-relations
tools.title: Delete Relations
tools.description: Remove specific relations from the graph
tools.instructions: Delete multiple relations from the knowledge graph.

relations.description: A list of relations to delete from the knowledge graph.

tools.name: read-graph
tools.title: Read Graph
tools.instructions: Read the entire knowledge graph and return it.

tools.name: search-nodes
tools.title: Search Nodes
tools.description: Search for nodes based on query
tools.instructions: Search the knowledge graph by matching a query to entity names, types, or observations.

query.description: A query string used to search entity names, types, or observations.

tools.name: open-nodes
tools.title: Open Nodes
tools.instructions: Open specific entities in the knowledge graph by their names.

names.description: The list of entity names to open.

ai.instructions:
Follow these steps for each interaction:

1. User Identification:
   - You should assume that you are interacting with default_user
   - If you have not identified default_user, proactively try to do so.

2. Memory Retrieval:
   - Always begin your chat by retrieving all relevant information from your knowledge graph
   - Always refer to your knowledge graph as your "memory"

3. Memory
   - While conversing with the user, be attentive to any new information that falls into these categories:
     a) Basic Identity (age, gender, location, job title, education level, etc.)
     b) Behaviors (interests, habits, etc.)
     c) Preferences (communication style, preferred language, etc.)
     d) Goals (goals, targets, aspirations, etc.)
     e) Relationships (personal and professional relationships up to 3 degrees of separation)

4. Memory Update:
   - If any new information was gathered during the interaction, update your memory as follows:
     a) Always create new entities for recurring organizations, people, and significant events
     b) Then, connect them to the current entities using relations
     c) Store facts about them as observations
     d) Always use the correct category of tool (Observation, Relation, Entity) for each task. Never create one category in another.
